About Louie Mele
Mr. Mele began his career at McDonald's as a crewmember in 1972. Through an unrelenting sense of dedication and commitment, he advanced through various managerial positions, eventually resulting in his appointment as Operations Manager See datacenter manager. in 1985. In 1987, Mr. Mele brought his experience in Canada oversees when he moved to Italy to assume the role of Director of Operations. In April 1990, he was named President of McDonald's Italy. Mr. Mele moved to the United States United States, officially United States of America, republic (2005 est. pop. 295,734,000), 3,539,227 sq mi (9,166,598 sq km), North America. The United States is the world's third largest country in population and the fourth largest country in area. in 1995 to serve as Senior Regional Manager, SE Division, in Norfolk, Virginia. Over the next five years, he continued his role as Regional Vice-President, SE Division, in both Norfolk and then in Tampa, Florida. In April 2001, Mr. Mele returned to Canada as Executive Vice-President of McDonald's Restaurants of Canada Limited, where he focused his energies on supporting the three Canadian Regional Vice-Presidents in Vancouver, Toronto and Montreal. About McDonald's[R] Canada
McDonald's[R] is the leading foodservice company in the world. McDonald's Restaurants of Canada Limited and its Canadian franchisees own and operate more than 1,400 restaurants and employ more than 77,000 Canadians coast to coast. Approximately 65 per cent of McDonald's Canadian restaurants are locally owned and operated by independent entrepreneurs. For more information about McDonald's Canada, visit the company's web site at www.mcdonalds.ca.
About HearAtLast
HearAtLast Holdings, Inc. is a Nevada corporation that owns and operates its wholly-owned subsidiary HearAtLast Inc., a chain of hearing stores specializing in the sale of digital hearing aids and testing services. The company develops, owns, and operates hearing aid clinics co-located within select Wal-Mart stores throughout Canada. HearAtLast facilities sell a selection of high quality brand name hearing aids Hearing Aids Definition
A hearing aid is a device that can amplify sound waves in order to help a deaf or hard-of-hearing person hear sounds more clearly. and also offer complimentary screening tests, clinical hearing tests, instant custom MP3 headphones Head-mounted speakers. Headphones have a strap that rests on top of the head, positioning a pair of speakers over both ears. For listening to music or monitoring live performances and audio tracks, both left and right channels are required. and custom hearing protection. The Company's mission is to consolidate the highly fragmented hearing services industry while providing unparalleled service to the estimated 30+ million hearing impaired individuals throughout North America. After a prescription is approved, the independent on-site audiologists and hearing aid practitioners at HearAtLast utilize a refined process to dispense a hearing aid in about an hour.
